alert.note: Alert for Blair; Cambria; Cameron; Clearfield; Elk; Northern Centre; Northern Clinton; Northern Lycoming; Potter; Somerset; Tioga (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 7:16PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF POTTER...MCKEAN...CLINTON... CAMERON...CENTRE...CLEARFIELD...LYCOMING...BLAIR...CAMBRIA AND SOMERSET COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to a quarter of a mile. Precipitation will start as rain before changing to heavy snow as the squall passes. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 712 PM EDT, a band of heavy rain and snow was along a line extending from Corning to 14 miles south of St. Marys to near Jeannette and moving southeast at 40 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Johnstown, Clearfield, Westmont, Mansfield, Ebensburg, Wellsboro, Nanty-Glo, Cameron, Northern Cambria, Wharton, Keating, Morris, Philipsburg, Woodland, Curwensville, Southmont, Elkland, Patton, Blossburg and Hyde. For those driving on Interstate 80, this includes areas between the Dubois Route 255 and Milesburg exits, specifically from mile markers 103 to 150. This includes The Pennsylvania Turnpike near mile marker 100. This includes the following highways... Route 6 from west of Galeton to the Bradford county line. Route 15 from Buttonwood to Lawrenceville. Route 22 from the Indiana County line to Ebensburg. Route 30 near the Westmoreland county line. Route 219 from the junction of route 22 to south of DuBois. Route 322 from south of DuBois to north of Port Matilda. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this snow squall. Roads are expected to remain just wet or locally slushy, but rapid changes in visibility and road conditions can lead to accidents. &&
